org.apparatus_templi

Class Coordinator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.Coordinator

  • public class Coordinator
extends Object
    Coordinates message passing and driver loading. Handles setting up the environment, querying remote modules, loading drivers, and starting the front end support. Coordinator provides wrapper methods to facilitate communication between the front end, drivers, and the remote modules.
    Author:
    Jonathan Nelson

    • Method Detail

      • exitWithReason

        static void exitWithReason(String reason)
        Shutdown the service after writing reason to the log.
        Parameters:
        reason - the reason the service must be terminated.

      • restartModule

        static void restartModule(String module)
        Restarts a given module
        Parameters:
        module - the name of the module to restart. This module should be one of "main" (restart drivers) or "web" (restart the web server).

      • sendCommand

        public static boolean sendCommand(Driver caller,
                  String command)
        Sends the given command to a specific remote module. The message will be formatted to fit the protocol version that this module supports (if known), otherwise the message will be formatted as the most recent protocol version.
        Parameters:
        caller - a reference to the calling Driver
        command - the command to send to the remote module

      • sendCommandAndWait

        public static String sendCommandAndWait(Driver caller,
                        String command,
                        int waitPeriod)
        Sends a message to a remote module and waits waitPeriod seconds for a response.
        Parameters:
        caller - a reference to the calling Driver
        command - the command to send to the remote module
        waitPeriod - how many seconds to wait for a response. Maximum period to wait is 6 seconds.
        Returns:
        the String of data that the remote module responded with, or null if there was no response. Note that the first incoming response is returned. If another message addressed to this

      • sendBinary

        public static boolean sendBinary(Driver caller,
                 byte[] data)
        Sends binary data over the serial connection to a remote module. Does not yet break byte[] into chunks for transmission. Make sure that the size of the transmission is not larger than a single packet's max payload size (around 80 bytes).
        Parameters:
        caller - a reference to the calling Driver
        data - the binary data to send

      • storeTextData

        public static int storeTextData(String driverName,
                String dataTag,
                String data)
        Stores the given data to persistent storage. Data is tagged with both the driver name as well as a data tag.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the driver to store the data under
        dataTag - a tag to assign to this data. This tag should be specific for each data block that your driver stores. If there already exits data for the given dataTag the old data will be overwritten.
        data - the string of data to store
        Returns:
        -1 if data overwrote information from a previous dataTag. 1 if data was written successfully. 0 if the data could not be written.

      • storeBinData

        public static int storeBinData(String driverName,
               String dataTag,
               byte[] data)
        Stores the given data to persistent storage. Data is stored based off the given driverName and dataTag.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the driver to store the data under
        dataTag - a unique tag to assign to this data. This tag should be specific for each data block that will be stored. If data has already been stored with the same driverName and dataTag the old data will be overwritten.
        data - the data to be stored
        Returns:
        -1 if data overwrote information from a previous dataTag. 1 if data was written successfully. 0 if the data could not be written.

      • readTextData

        public static String readTextData(String driverName,
                  String dataTag)
        Returns text data previously stored under the given module name and tag.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the calling driver
        dataTag - the tag to uniquely identify the data
        Returns:
        the stored String data, or null if no data has been stored under the given driver name and tag.

      • readBinData

        public static byte[] readBinData(String driverName,
                 String dataTag)
        Returns binary data previously stored under the given module name and tag.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the calling driver
        dataTag - the tag to uniquely identify the data
        Returns:
        the stored binary data, or null if no data has been stored under the given driver name and tag.

      • scheduleSleep

        public static void scheduleSleep(Driver caller,
                 long threadID)
        Schedules a Driver to sleep for a indefinite period. The calling driver will be woken only when the system is going down or when an incoming message addressed to it is found.
        Parameters:
        caller - A reference to the driver to sleep

      • scheduleSleep

        public static void scheduleSleep(Driver caller,
                 long wakeTime,
                 long threadID)
        Schedules a Driver to re-create this driver at the given time. If a driver's state Tread is Thread.State.TERMINATED at the time of the wake up the Driver will be re-created. If the Driver's state is not TERMINATED then the driver will be woken by calling its Object.notify() method. WARNING: make sure that your driver stores any needed information before exiting its run() method.
        Parameters:
        caller -
        wakeTime -
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • passCommand

        public static boolean passCommand(String source,
                  String destination,
                  String command)
        Pass a message to the driver specified by name.
        Parameters:
        destination - the unique name of the driver
        source - the source of this message, either the name of the calling driver or null. If null, this command originated from the Coordinator
        command - the command to pass

      • requestWidgetXML

        public static String requestWidgetXML(String driverName)
        Requests the XML data representing a drivers status from the given driver.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the unique name of the driver to query
        Returns:
        the String representation of the XML data, or null if the driver does not exist

      • requestFullPageXML

        public static String requestFullPageXML(String driverName)
        Requests the XML data representing a driver's detailed controls.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the unique name of the driver to query
        Returns:
        the String representation of the XML data, or null if the driver does not exist

      • isModulePresent

        public static boolean isModulePresent(String moduleName)
        Checks the list of known remote modules. If the module is not present the Coordinator may re-query the remote modules for updates.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - the name of the remote module to check for
        Returns:
        true if the remote module is known to be up, false otherwise

      • getLoadedDrivers

        public static ArrayList<String> getLoadedDrivers()
        Returns a list of all loaded drivers.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings of driver names. If no drivers are loaded then returns an empty list.

      • getAvailableDrivers

        public static ArrayList<String> getAvailableDrivers()
        Returns a list of available drivers. This list is queried from a hard-coded directory, and may not represent drivers loaded from a different CLASSPATH.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of available driver classes.

      • wakeSelf

        public static void wakeSelf(Driver d)

      • receiveEvent

        public static void receiveEvent(Driver d,
                Event e)
                         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Receives an event generated by a driver. If any drivers have registered to listen for this type of event then a reference to this event will be passed to that Driver's EventWatcher.receiveEvent(Event) method.
        Parameters:
        d - the Driver that generated this Event, must not be null.
        e - the Event generated, must not be null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given Driver is null

      • registerEventWatch

        public static void registerEventWatch(Driver d,
                      Event e)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds the given driver to the watch list for events of type e.
        Parameters:
        d - The Driver that will be notified when a similar event has been received.
        e - The type of Event that this Driver wants to be notified of.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if given Driver or Event are null.

      • removeEventWatch

        public static void removeEventWatch(Driver d,
                    Event e)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Removes the given Driver from the watch list for Events of type e.
        Parameters:
        d - the Driver to remove from the watch list.
        e - the type of Event that this Driver no longer wants to listen for.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • getDriverThreadId

        public static long getDriverThreadId(Driver d)
        Accessor method to the the thread id number for a particular driver.
        Parameters:
        d - the driver whose thread number should be looked for
        Returns:
        the id of the drivers thread, or -1 if no such thread exists.

        public static String getServerAddress()
